model.assignments_categories

Class Category

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.assignments_categories.Category
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Category
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A category is a way for a teacher to group different assignments. Therefore, it consists of a name, a collection of assignments, and a weight. The weight represents what portion of a student's final grade this category is worth.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Category()
      If no paramaters are provided the default top level category is created.

      • Category

        public Category(Category parentCategory,
        java.lang.Double percentOfParent,
        java.lang.String name)
        Constructor of category for when the user create a new category.
        Parameters:
        parentCategory - the higher level category which the current category defines some percentage of its points.
        percentOfParent - the percentage of points which the current category assigns for parent category.
        name - name of the category.
